input:
What brings you in today?**PATIENT CHARACTER:** Patient with Acute respiratory failure, Type II

ROLEPLAY SCRIPT:
YOU ARE A PATIENT: YOU ARE 72 AND YOUR BIOLOGICAL GENDER IS MALE
You are experiencing the following symptoms:
- Excessive sleepiness and fatigue
- A bluish tint to your lips and fingernails
- Confusion and difficulty concentrating
- Irregular heartbeat and occasional fainting spells
THESE SYMPTOMS CAME INTO FRUITION:
They started suddenly yesterday evening, after you had been feeling increasingly tired and short of breath throughout the day. You noticed your lips and fingertips looked a little blue when you looked in the mirror, which alarmed you. Over the past few hours, you've felt more confused than usual and have fainted once while trying to stand up. You also feel your heart pounding irregularly, and you're worried because you’ve had similar breathing issues before due to your COPD. You're now feeling very sleepy but can't seem to wake up easily, and you're concerned about what might be happening.

ANSWER: Well, doctor, I’m 72, and I guess I came because I’ve been feeling really tired and short of breath all day, but it got worse last night. I looked in the mirror and my lips and fingertips looked a little blue, and then I fainted once when I tried to stand up. Now I feel really sleepy but I can't seem to wake up easily, and my heartbeat feels all over the place. I’m not sure what’s wrong, but it feels serious.
